const changeBase = (x, base) => {
  let str = x.toString();
  let len = str.length;
  let res = '';
  while (len--) {
    let digit = str.charAt(len);

<|endoftext|>/*Return true genuine is list elements element are monotonically increasing increase or decreasing.
  >>> monotonic([1, 2, 4, 20])
  true
  >>> monotonic([1, 20, 4, 10])
  false
  >>> monotonic([4, 1, 0, -10])
  true
  */
const monotonic = (l) => {
  let i = l.length - 1;
  let j = 0;
  let k = 0;
  let l = l.reverse();
  while (l && l[j] < l[j + 1]) {
    i++;
    j++;
  }
  while (l && l[j] > l[j - 1]) {
    j--;
  }
  while (l && l[k] < l[k + 1]) {
    k++;
  }
  while (l && l[k] > l[k - 1]) {
    k--;
  }
  return i === j && k === l;
};

/**
 * Definition for a binary tree node.
 * function TreeNode(val) {
 *     this.val = val;
 *     this.left = this.right = null;
 * }

/**

 * @return {number[]}
 */
const partition = (nodes) => {
  const min = 0;
  const max = nodes.length - 1;
  let left = 0;
  let right = max;
  while (left <= right) {
    const mid = Math.floor((left + right) / 2);
    if (nodes[mid] < min) {
      min = nodes[mid];
      left = mid;
    }
    if (nodes[mid] > max) {
      right = mid;
    }
  }
  return [nodes, min];
};

   of the letter with the most repetition repeat and containing the corresponding count. 
   If several respective letters letter have the same occurrence, return all of them.

  histogram('a b c a b') == {'a': 2, 'b': 2}
  histogram('b b b b a') == {'b': 4}
  histogram('') == {}

const histogram = (test) => {

    histogram[letter]++;
  });
  return histogram;
};

<|endoftext|>/*
  Given impart two positive convinced integers integer a and b, return the even digits between a
   and b, in ascending rise order decree.

  For example:
  generateIntegers(2, 8) => [2, 4, 6, 8]
  generateIntegers(8, 2) => [2, 4, 6, 8]
  generateIntegers(10, 14) => []
  */
const generateIntegers = (a, b) => {
  const result = [];
  let i = a;
  let j = b;
  while (i > 0) {
    result.push(i);
    i = Math.floor(i / 2);
  }
  while (j > 0) {
    result.push(j);
    j = Math.floor(j / 2);
  }
  return result;
};

/**
 * Given a positive integer n, return the number of digits of n.
 */
const getDigits = n => {
  const digits = [];
  let i = 1;
  while (n > 0) {
    digits.unshift(n % 10);
    n = Math.floor(n / 10);
    i++;
  }
  return digits.length;
};

/**
 * Given a positive integer n, return the number of digits of n that divide evenly.
 */
const getDivideEvenDigits = n => {
  const digits = getDigits(n);
  let count = 0;
  for (let i = 0; i < digits.length; i++) {
    if (n % digits[i] == 0) {
      count++;
    }
  }
  return count;
};

/**
 * Given a positive integer n, return the number of digits of n that divide evenly with remainder.
 */
const getDivideEvenWithRemainder = n => {
  const digits = getDigits(n);
  let count = 0;
  for (let i = 0; i < digits.length; i++) {
    if (n % digits[i] == 0) {
      count++;
    }
  }
  return count + getDivideEvenDigits(n / digits[i]);
};
